DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Patient DICOM Age Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The size or magnitude representing the period of life since birth based on the DICOM standard format as a string of characters with one of the following formats -- nnnD, nnnW, nnnM, nnnY; where nnn shall contain the number of days for D, weeks for W, months for M, or years for Y.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The years since birth of a person undergoing a radiographic technique.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/12/09 DEC versioned for change in OC concept to Image Study (C63859) requested by the VCDE Silver Review Team.  6/6/07 -DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: AS: The size or magnitude representing the period of life since birth based on the DICOM standard format as a string of characters with one of the following formats -- nnnD, nnnW, nnnM, nnnY; where nnn shall contain the number of days for D, weeks for W, months for M, or years for Y.  [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/07-Released for NCIA CDE curation. ;  5/31/07-Create for CDEs using the DICOM Age format for age; based on 2007 DICOM Standard, section 3.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/17/09 superseded CDE to reflect change from clinical study to image study OC concept per VCDE NCIA interim report.  6/25/07 -CDE created to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.
